definition: place/location/spot/point/office/department/bureau/respect/classifier for locations or items of damage: spot, point
to reside/to live/to dwell/to be in/to be situated at/to stay/to get along with/to be in a position of/to deal with/to discipline/to punish

sentences.english: The people who allowed torture have faced no punishment at all.
sentences.chinese: 而那些允許酷刑的人卻不會受到任何處罰。

sentences.english: Rain and snow don't penalize your Spot and Search checks.
sentences.chinese: 你的偵察和搜尋檢定不再因雨和雪受到處罰。

sentences.english: Any judicial officer who abuses his power and commits the crime mentioned in the preceding paragraph shall be given a heavier punishment.
sentences.chinese: 司法工作人員濫用職權，犯前款罪的，從重處罰。

sentences.english: Punish recidivists with increased sentences is explicitly promulgated in many countries' penal codes.
sentences.chinese: 加重處罰累犯，在很多國家的刑法典中都有明確規定。

sentences.english: After I did the drive-through, I got stuck behind Fernando (Alonso).
sentences.chinese: 我做了處罰後，我被壓制在了阿隆索後面。

sentences.english: The Security Administration Punishment Law being paid close attention to has been enacted recently.
sentences.chinese: 倍受矚目的《治安管理處罰法》新近出臺。

sentences.english: Criminal penalties are often imposed for acts referred to as willful or knowing violations.
sentences.chinese: 刑事處罰常常用來約束那些涉及到故意犯罪行爲。

sentences.english: Of course, if incorrigible, we will have the appropriate punishment.
sentences.chinese: 當然，如果屢教不改，我們將會有相應的處罰。

sentences.english: The punishment for his immediate family might be only slightly more lenient.
sentences.chinese: 對他家庭的處罰可能會稍微輕點。

sentences.english: Dogs are not to be penalized if shown with a summer coat.
sentences.chinese: 公犬不應爲夏季被毛而遭到處罰。

sentences.english: You don't see so much of it in Finland because they penalise you heavily for it.
sentences.chinese: 在芬蘭你不太能看到，因爲對這種行爲的處罰很重。

sentences.english: An offender who attempts to commit a crime may, in comparison with one who completes the crime, be given a lighter or mitigated punishment.
sentences.chinese: 對於未遂犯，可以比照既遂犯從輕或者減輕處罰。

sentences.english: If an adminis. rative sanction is. obviously unfair, it may be amended by judgment.
sentences.chinese: 行政處罰顯失公正的，可以判決變更。

sentences.english: Is a worker terminated or disciplined who is not willing to work in overtimes ?
sentences.chinese: 不願加班的工人是否會被解僱或紀律處罰？

sentences.english: The WTO undetermines local development and penalizes poor countries.
sentences.chinese: WTO拒絕地方發展和處罰貧窮國家。

sentences.english: The form of decision for administrative penalty shall be given to the party on the spot.
sentences.chinese: 行政處罰決定書應當當場交付當事人。

definition: to discipline sb/to punish/disciplinary action/to deal with (a matter)/CL:個|个[ge4]
provision/to fix/to set/to formulate/to stipulate/to provide/regulation/rule/CL:個|个[ge4]
to implement/to carry out/to execute/to run
